PaymentAuthAdjustment.name: PaymentAuthAdjustment
PaymentAuthAdjustment.description: Shows information about an adjustment made to an authorized transaction.

AccountId.description: The account for the payment authorization adjustment. Inherited from the payment authorization.

Amount.description: Amount of adjustment applied to the parent payment authorization.

Comments.description: Users can add comments to provide additional details about a record. Maximum of 1000 characters.

CurrencyIsoCode.description: Three-letter ISO 4217 currency code associated with the payment authorization adjustment record.

Date.description: The date that the adjustment occurred.

EffectiveDate.description: The date that the adjustment takes effect on the authorization.

Email.description: Email address of the parent payment authorization owner.

GatewayDate.description: The date and time that the reversal transaction occurred in the payment gateway.

GatewayRefDetails.description: Additional data that can’t be stored in other fields on the payment record. You can use this field for transactions following the initial transaction that creates the payment record. You can use any data that isn’t normalized in financial entities. This field has a maximum length of 1000 characters and can store data as JSON or XML.

GatewayRefNumber.description: Unique transaction ID created by the payment gateway.

GatewayResultCode.description: Gateway-specific result code. Must be mapped to a Salesforce-specific result code

GatewayResultCodeDescription.description: Description of the gateway’s result code. This field is useful for providing more information around why the gateway returned a certain result code.

IpAddress.description: The IP address of the user who initiated the payment adjustment.

LastReferencedDate.description: The timestamp for when the current user last viewed a record related to this record.

LastViewedDate.description: The timestamp for when the current user last viewed this record. If this value is null, this record might only have been referenced (LastReferencedDate) and not viewed.

MacAddress.description: The MAC address of the person who initiated the payment.

PaymentAuthAdjustmentNumber.description: System-provided unique ID for a payment authorization adjustment record.

PaymentAuthorizationId.description: ID of the payment authorization on which the adjustment occurred.

PaymentIntentId.description: ID of the payment intent record.

Phone.description: Phone number of the customer who initiated the authorization adjustment.

ProcessingMode.description: Defines whether the payment has been made outside of the payment platform.

SfResultCode.description: Salesforce-specific result code that can map to one or more gateway result codes. We recommend configuring the payment gateway adapter layer to map gateway result codes to the appropriate Salesforce result code.

Status.description: Defines the state of the payment authorization reversal.

Type.description: Defines how the customer used the reversal.

PaymentAuthAdjustment.accessRules: Salesforce Payments, Salesforce Order Management, B2B Commerce, D2C Commerce, Lightning Experience
